title: Erdős Problem #883: Cycles in the Coprime Graph
description: For a large subset A of {1,...,n}, does the coprime graph G(A) contain all short odd cycles? Question 2 SOLVED by Sárkőzy (1999). Question 1 remains open.

overview.historicalContext: Erdős Problem #883 studies cycle structure in the coprime graph on subsets of integers. Erdős-Sárkőzy (1997) proved odd cycles of length cn exist above the threshold. Sárkőzy (1999) solved Question 2 on tripartite subgraphs. The threshold floor(n/2) + floor(n/3) - floor(n/6) arises from inclusion-exclusion on multiples of 2 and 3.
overview.problemStatement: For A subset of {1,...,n}, let G(A) be the coprime graph. Question 1 (Open): If |A| > floor(n/2) + floor(n/3) - floor(n/6), does G(A) contain all odd cycles of length at most n/3 + 1? Question 2 (Solved): Does the same threshold guarantee a complete (1,l,l) tripartite subgraph?
overview.proofStrategy: The formalization defines the coprime graph using SimpleGraph, the threshold via inclusion-exclusion, and the extremal set (multiples of 2 or 3). Erdős-Sárkőzy (odd cycles for cn) and Sárkőzy (tripartite subgraphs) are axiomatized. Three proved theorems: erdos_883_question_2_solved, erdos_883_partial, and erdos_883.
keyInsights: Coprime graph: two integers are adjacent iff gcd = 1
Threshold from inclusion-exclusion: multiples of 2 + multiples of 3 - multiples of 6
Extremal set (multiples of 2 or 3) has size = threshold but no triangles
Above threshold, odd cycles of length proportional to n exist (Erdős-Sárkőzy)
Sárkőzy showed (1,l,l) tripartite subgraphs with l proportional to log n / log log n

sections.title: Part I: The Coprime Graph
sections.summary: Defines coprimeGraph using SimpleGraph, threshold value floor(n/2) + floor(n/3) - floor(n/6), and threshold_eq_divisible_2_or_3 axiom.

sections.title: Part II: The Extremal Example
sections.summary: Defines extremalSet (multiples of 2 or 3). Axiomatizes extremal_set_triangle_free: no triangles in coprime graph.

sections.title: Part III: Erdős-Sárkőzy Theorem on Odd Cycles
sections.summary: Axiomatizes erdos_sarkozy_odd_cycles: above threshold, G(A) contains odd cycles of length at most cn.

sections.title: Part IV: Question 1 - All Short Odd Cycles
sections.summary: Defines erdos_883_question_1: does G(A) contain all odd cycles of length at most n/3 + 1? Axiom question_1_open.

sections.title: Part V: Sárkőzy's Theorem on Complete Tripartite Subgraphs
sections.summary: Defines hasTripartite for (1,l,l) tripartite graphs. Axiomatizes sarkozy_tripartite: above threshold with l > 0.

sections.title: Part VI: Main Results
sections.summary: Proved theorems: erdos_883_question_2_solved, erdos_883_partial, and erdos_883. Q2 solved, Q1 partial.

sections.title: Part VII: Properties of the Coprime Graph
sections.summary: Placeholder chromatic number axiom, isCoprimeCycle definition, triangles_above_threshold axiom.

sections.title: Part VIII: Connection to Inclusion-Exclusion
sections.summary: Proved threshold_by_inclusion_exclusion (rfl). Axiom threshold_asymptotic: threshold(n) at most 2n/3 + 1.

conclusion.summary: Erdős Problem #883 is PARTIALLY SOLVED. Question 1 (all odd cycles of length at most n/3 + 1) remains open, though Erdős-Sárkőzy proved cycles of length cn exist. Question 2 (tripartite subgraphs) was solved by Sárkőzy (1999).
conclusion.implications: The results connect number theory and extremal graph theory through coprimality. The coprime graph structure above the threshold exhibits rich subgraph structure.
openQuestions: Does the specific constant 1/3 work for Question 1?
What is the optimal constant c in the Erdős-Sárkőzy theorem?
Can the log n / log log n bound for l be improved?
Analogous problems for other arithmetic graphs?
